tiles¶

Contains definitions of the tile grid, and its constituting tiles. Also contains methods, which fill, transform, and sort the tile grid.

Author: Marek Dohnal

Date: 18/03/2023

class tiles.Tile(fill_layers=None, color=(255, 0, 0), shape=None, size=5)¶

Bases: object

Represents a tile from the input grid.

add_fill_layer(fill_layer)¶

Adds a fill layer to the tile

Parameters:

fill_layer – A fill layer filled during recognition

color¶

The background color of the tile (R, G, B)

fill_layers¶

Layers filled during recognition containing pixel coordinates (row, col) on the input grid

set_size()¶

Sets the size of the tile based on the length of fill layers.

shape¶

Inner shape of the tile

size¶

Tile size is the number of fill layers

class tiles.TileGrid(grid=None)¶

Bases: object

Represents an array of tiles, is an abstraction of the input grid.

static _direction_to_coords_(direction, row, col)¶
Parameters:

direction – A relative direction from the perspective of a central

cell in a Moore neighbourhood :param row: row of the central cell :param col: column of the central cell :return: absolute coordinates of a cell in the chosen direction

static _extend_tile_into_borders_(orig_grid, out_img)¶

Extends the fill of all tiles into borders, until all borders are erased.

Parameters:

  • orig_grid – The input grid

  • out_img – The output image, where borders are erased

add_tile(tile, tile_num, num_of_tiles_on_rows)¶

Adds tile to the tile grid

Parameters:

  • tile – is the tile to be added

  • tile_num – is the number of the tile, in order of recognition

  • num_of_tiles_on_rows – is a list of

apply_transformation_step(smaller_shape_dir='N', lighter_bg_color_dir='N', lighter_shape_color_dir='N', is_sorted_by_type=False)¶

Applies a transformation (sorting) step according to specified properties

Parameters:

  • is_sorted_by_type – True if sort by shape type is wished to be applied, false otherwise

  • smaller_shape_dir – direction of movement of a tile with a smaller shape

  • lighter_bg_color_dir – direction of movement of a tile with a lighter background color

  • lighter_shape_color_dir – direction of movement of a tile with a lighter shape color

Returns:

true if the order of anything was changed.

grid¶

Two dimensional array containing tiles

init_tile_attributes(bg_colors, shape_colors, shapes)¶

Represents an initial permutation of the tile grid. Tiles are initialized with specified values.

Parameters:

  • shape_colors – A list of shape colors and their occurrences

  • bg_colors – A list of background colors and their occurrences

  • shapes – A list of shapes to choose from randomly

sort_tiles()¶

Sorts tiles in a row in ascending order based on the column of the first point in fill layers.

to_image(grid, border_color=None)¶

Converts the input grid and it’s corresponding tile grid into an output image

Parameters:

  • grid – the input grid

  • border_color – the color of the tile borders, if None, then tile fill is extended into borders

Returns:

output image

to_rect_shape()¶

Converts the tile grid into a rectangular shape if it has rows of different lengths.
